author: Joe Deaux, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Eric Martin
description: Trade negotiations between the US and Mexico are homing in on a possible quota system to reduce tariffs on a certain volume of steel imports, a move seen as assuaging concerns of American manufacturers of the metal.
title: US, Mexico Eye Import Quota in Trade Talks on Steel Deal

author: Oma Seddiq, Emily Birnbaum
description: Staunch opposition from a handful of Republican lawmakers is endangering the tech industry’s drive to attach a ban on state regulation of artificial intelligence to Donald Trump’s tax bill.
title: AI Titans Struggle to Use Rising Clout to Block State Regulation

author: Anthony Capaccio, Alex Wickham, Natalia Drozdiak
description: Early intelligence findings suggest US airstrikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities had only a limited impact, people familiar with the matter said, challenging President Donald Trump’s claim that the uranium-enrichment sites had been “totally obliterated.”
title: US Strikes Had Limited Impact on Iran’s Nuclear Program, Early Report Shows

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK said it would buy at least 12 new US-made F-35A fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear weapons, the latest attempt by Prime Minister Keir Starmer to curry favor with President Donald Trump.
title: UK Will Buy Nuclear-Capable F-35s in Next Bid to Woo Trump

author: Andrea Palasciano, Stephanie Lai, Ania Nussbaum
description: Donald Trump ensured that NATO’s high-stakes summit would be a nervy affair to the end as he flew in to The Hague fueling doubts about whether the US remains fully committed to defending its allies.
title: NATO Tries to Use Charm to Keep Trump On Its Side

author: Erica Yokoyama, Akemi Terukina
description: Japan should focus on enhancing its defense capabilities, not chasing spending goals, the ruling party’s policy chief said, following Trump administration calls for US allies to target higher military expenditure.
title: Japan Policy Chief Hits Back at US Call for 5% Defense Spending

description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A new U.S. intelligence report found that Iran’s nuclear program has been set back only a few months after a U.S. strike and was not “completely and fully obliterated” as President Donald Trump has said, according to two people familiar with the early assessment.
title: Early Report Suggests US Strikes Only Set Back Iran Nuclear Program by Months

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at a consequential few days in Trump’s presidency. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Emerges From Mideast Intervention With a Victory-For Now

author: Ari Natter, Erik Wasson
description: Shares of solar companies surged after a Republican Senator said lawmakers are discussing changes to a provision in President Donald Trump’s broad spending bill that would abruptly end tax credits for rooftop panels.
title: Solar Stocks Soar as GOP Mulls Changes to Tax Credits in Bill

author: Kate Sullivan, Stephanie Lai, Natalia Drozdiak
description: The White House has begun hiring more staff at the National Security Council, people familiar with the matter said, reversing course weeks after President Donald Trump significantly cut the size of the council and as the US confronts a host of foreign-policy crises.
title: Trump Administration Restaffs National Security Council After Cutting Its Size

author: Myles Miller
description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is moving resources off immigration cases and back to counterterrorism, citing potential threats after the US launched airstrikes on Iranian nuclear sites and helped broker a ceasefire between Iran and Israel following nearly two weeks of fighting.
title: FBI Shifts Focus From Immigration to Terrorism Amid Israel-Iran Conflict

author: Cam Kettles
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said House and Senate Republicans can cut a deal on the state and local tax deduction within the next two days, resolving one of the key issues that has stymied President Donald Trump’s economic legislation.
title: Bessent Predicts Republicans Reach SALT Truce Within 48 Hours

author: Shruti Singh
description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker, the billionaire Democrat and vocal critic of President Donald Trump, is expected to announce a bid for a third term on Thursday, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Pritzker Expected to Seek Third Term as Illinois Governor

author: Erik Larson
description: Nearly two dozen US states sued the Trump administration to stop it from using what they say is a spending loophole to cut billions of dollars in federal grants without congressional approval.
title: States Step Up Fight With Trump Administration on Grant Cuts

author: Olga Tanas
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has called his government’s 10-year industrial strategy “a turning point” for the nation’s economy, but for an oil and gas lobby the plan must include tax reform for North Sea energy producers.
title: UK Industrial Plan Must Have North Sea Tax Reform, Group Says

author: Thomas Seal
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada can meet a steep expected increase in its North Atlantic Treaty Organization obligations spending partly by leaning on the country’s bounty of critical minerals.
title: Carney Says Canada Can Hit $110 Billion NATO Bill With Mines

author: Laura Nahmias
description: New Yorkers are facing a barrage of last-minute advertisements across social media, television and pamphlets in the closely-watched Democratic primary for Mayor, fueled by donations from hedge fund managers, business titans and advocacy groups.
title: Tight NYC Mayoral Race Drives Donations to Groups Backing Cuomo, Mamdani

author: Dina Esfandiary
description: Iran spent decades expanding its reach in the Middle East by building a network of partners that came to be known as the “axis of resistance.” Yet it found itself standing alone to face the recent attacks by Israel, which the US joined by bombing three of the Islamic Republic’s key nuclear facilities. A tentative ceasefire with Israel went into effect on June 24.
title: Why Iran Faced Israel and the US Alone as Its Friends Stood By

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union plans to impose retaliatory tariffs on US imports, including on Boeing Co. aircraft, if President Donald Trump puts a baseline levy on the bloc’s goods as many expect.
title: EU Prepares to Retaliate If US Imposes Baseline Tariffs on Bloc

author: Freya Jones
description: The proportion of Britons who see the US as a friendly nation hit a record low after five months of a Donald Trump presidency characterized by a global tariff war and a critical attitude toward the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.
title: Britons Lose Faith in US Alliance Amid Trump Tariffs, Poll Says

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, John Tozzi
description: Prescription drug middlemen should end the complicated system of drug rebates before the government steps in to change it, Medicare and Medicaid chief Mehmet Oz said Tuesday.
title: Dr. Oz Pushes Drug Middlemen to End Rebates Before Washington Acts

author: Daniel Basteiro, Thomas Gualtieri
description: Spain’s government will give the country’s competition authority more powers to supervise private operators’ management of electricity voltage following the nationwide blackout in April.
title: Spain Regulator to Get More Powers to Oversee Electricity System

author: Erik Wasson, Maeve Sheehey
description: Bipartisan congressional briefings on the weekend US strike on Iranian nuclear facilities have been postponed as Iran and Israel appeared Tuesday to honor a ceasefire agreement.
title: US Congressional Iran Briefings Postponed After Ceasefire Agreement

author: Grant Smith
description: President Donald Trump said China can continue to purchase oil from Iran, abruptly easing the “maximum pressure” the US had been applying to the Middle Eastern country’s economic lifeblood.
title: Trump Eases Pressure on Iran by Saying China Can Buy Its Oil

author: Gregory Korte, Stacie Sherman
description: Primary day in New York City’s mayoral contest has arrived, and there’s plenty of drama.
title: How Ranked-Choice Voting Could Sway New York’s Mayoral Primary

author: Alicia Diaz, Erik Wasson, Cam Kettles
description: President Donald Trump is ratcheting up pressure on Republican holdouts on his multi-trillion dollar tax bill while he’s participating in the annual NATO Summit in the Netherlands this week amid entrenched GOP divisions that put a self-imposed July 4 deadline at risk.
title: Trump Amps Up Pressure on GOP Holdouts on His Massive Tax Bill

author: Josh Wingrove, Andrea Palasciano, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Secretary General Mark Rutte is fighting to stop the NATO summit from spinning out of control after President Donald Trump cast doubt on the US commitment to defend its allies.
title: Trump Sparks Fear Over NATO Future With Doubts on Defense Pledge

author: Neil Munshi, Fiona MacDonald, Peter Martin
description: After a shaky ceasefire, the question is what comes next. But people in the region — like investors and oil traders — are taking it in their stride.
title: Twelve Days of War Turn Unthinkable Into Mundane in Middle East

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Trump administration officials considered a range of options in case of a major oil supply disruption in the Middle East ahead of the US strikes on Iran and President Donald Trump’s ceasefire declaration, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Weighed Range of Options for Oil Supply Disruptions

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Leaders beware of texting with Donald Trump, you might just find your private correspondence leaked by the US president himself on Truth Social for global consumption.
title: Trump Discloses Flattering Private Message From NATO Chief Rutte

author: Michael Shepard
description: Blowback to President Donald Trump’s idea of tariffs on imported semiconductors is proving to be broad and deep, stretching from auto companies and boat makers to the technology industry and crypto enthusiasts, according to a review of more than 150 public comments on the proposal.
title: Trump’s Chip Tariff Threat Sparks Pushback From Auto Industry to Tech

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Firat Kozok
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan plans to seek support from German Chancellor Friedrich Merz for the sale of Eurofighter jets to Turkey at talks on the sidelines of the NATO summit.
title: Erdogan to Seek Support From Merz for Eurofighter Sale to Turkey

description: Jerome Powell, chairman of the US Federal Reserve, during a Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee hearing in Washington in February. Photographer: Tierney L. Cross/Bloomberg
title: Fed’s Powell Testifies Before US House on Monetary Policy

author: Marc Champion
description: Trump still faces tough calls that will decide the future of non-proliferation.
title: There Is No One-and-Done on Iran

author: Katanga Johnson
description: US Senator Elizabeth Warren criticized potential reforms to a key bank capital buffer ahead of regulators’ meetings this week, saying the rule is a “critical safeguard” that promotes financial stability.
title: Elizabeth Warren Blasts Regulators’ Potential Bank Leverage-Rule Changes

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump declined to say if he would commit to NATO’s Article 5, which requires members to defend each other from attack, as he headed to a crucial summit of the military alliance, where his unwavering commitment to that very principle is at stake.
title: Trump Questions What NATO Mutual Defense Doctrine Really Means

author: Julian Lee
description: Shipments dropped on maintenance at Kozmino and a slowdown at Primorsk
title: Russian Crude Exports Touch Two-Month Low as Pacific Flows Slump

author: Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigeria’s anti-graft authorities arrested the former chief financial officer of the state oil company and a former head of a refinery in connection with an alleged misappropriation of funds.
title: Nigeria Arrests Ex-CFO of State Oil Firm Over Alleged Fraud

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: A special counsel investigating former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s imposition of martial law has requested an arrest warrant, citing his repeated refusal to comply with summonses, the counsel’s office said.
title: South Korea Requests Arrest Warrant for Former President Yoon

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: Senate Republicans are aiming to wipe away some $3.8 trillion of federal budget red ink from the GOP’s signature tax-and-spending bill with an unprecedented parliamentary maneuver, stoking concerns about long-term US fiscal policy.
title: Republican Move to Mask $3.8 Trillion Tax-Cut Cost Rings Alarms

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump ordered Israel to stop dropping bombs on Iran, calling it a “major violation” of a fragile ceasefire between the two countries he announced just hours ago.
title: Trump Tells Israel to Stop Dropping Bombs to Save Iran Truce

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: US President Donald Trump’s declaration of a ceasefire between Israel and Iran may curb the exchange of missile fire, but the biggest mystery of the war remains unsolved: the location of Tehran’s near-bomb-grade uranium.
title: Israel-Iran War Truce Highlights Mystery of Missing Uranium

author: Jennifer Welch
description: The last thing the world wants to contemplate in the wake of the US-Iran military showdown is a Russian attack on NATO.
title: NATO Confronts Its Doomsday Scenario

author: Arsalan Shahla, Fiona MacDonald, Catherine Lucey
description: A ceasefire declared by US President Donald Trump between Israel and Iran is being put to the test in its early hours, after a missile fired into Israel prompted accusations of a breach.
title: Trump-Hailed Truce Falters With Israel Accusing Iran of a Breach

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is poised to meet US President Donald Trump on the sidelines of the NATO summit in a bid to turn the page on strained relations between the two countries, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Erdogan Set to Meet Trump at NATO Summit to Reset US-Turkey Ties

author: Kevin Orland
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith expects a private-sector firm to propose a new oil pipeline to the British Columbia coast within weeks in a bid to become one of the first entrants on the Canadian government’s list of nationally important projects.
title: Alberta Premier Expects New Oil Pipeline Proposal Within Weeks

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: The International Criminal Court’s deputy prosecutor has asked the pre-trial chamber to reject former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte’s request for interim release to another country.
title: ICC Prosecutor Blocks Duterte’s Request for Interim Release

author: Tom Rees
description: London’s population is expected to jump by a further 600,000 by 2032, according to official projections that suggest a ratcheting up of pressure on the capital’s constrained housing market.
title: London Population Set to Jump 600,000 Putting Strain on Housing

author: Oliver Crook, Milda Seputyte
description: There are no indications “as of this morning” that the US is planning to scale down its military presence in the European Union’s eastern member states, Lithuania’s Foreign Minister Kestutis Budrys said in a Bloomberg Television interview on Tuesday.
title: No Sign US Plans to Scale Down Forces in EU East, Lithuania Says

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Europe’s plans to unleash trillions of euros in new defense spending will be a huge missed opportunity unless the region can work out how to raise productivity in the process.
title: NATO Cash Bonanza Risks Becoming Europe’s Lost Chance for Growth

author: Katia Dmitrieva
description: Two weeks from President Donald Trump’s self-imposed deadline to reach deals with the US’s major trading partners, some of the most-watched talks aimed at clinching agreements to avoid higher tariffs are struggling to get over the finish line.
title: Pressure to Seal Trump Trade Deals Ramps Up With Two Weeks to Go

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India’s Defense Minister Rajnath Singh will visit China — his first trip in five years — amid ongoing efforts by the world’s two most populous nations to mend ties after the 2020 border clashes.
title: India’s Defense Minister Heads to China After a Five-Year Gap

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany will borrow about a fifth more than planned in the third quarter to fund a surge in spending on infrastructure and the military, while a deal to secure a €46 billion ($53.3 billion) package of tax breaks highlighted how debt needs are set to grow.
title: Germany to Sell More Debt as Coalition Lifts Defense Outlays

author: Alex Wickham
description: Labour party opponents of the UK government’s £5 billion ($6.8 billion) cut to disability benefits have secured enough support to block the plan, setting up a high-stakes test of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s leadership less than a year into office.
title: Labour Rebels Get Enough Support to Kill Starmer’s Welfare Cuts

author: Julien Ponthus
description: Former French Prime Minister Dominique de Villepin announced late Monday he was creating a new political party ahead of the 2027 presidential election.
title: Former French PM de Villepin Forms Party Ahead of 2027 Election

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany’s ruling coalition reached an agreement with the country’s state premiers on how to share the financial burden from a €46 billion ($53 billion) package of tax breaks intended to boost economic growth.
title: Germany Clears Path for €46 Billion in Tax Cuts With State Deal

author: Josh Xiao
description: Singapore’s Prime Minister Lawrence Wong pledged to deepen bilateral cooperation in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as the trade-dependent city-state confronts intensifying tensions between Beijing and Washington.
title: Singapore’s Premier Vows Closer China Cooperation in Xi Meeting

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korea’s foreign minister nominee Cho Hyun pledged to make resuming the US-North Korea dialogue a top priority, underscoring new President Lee Jae Myung’s vision of building lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula.
title: Seoul Foreign Minister Pick to Prioritize US-North Korea Talks

author: William Horobin
description: Negotiations over France’s contentious retirement reform ended in deadlock late Monday, raising the chances of government collapse should opposition parties unite in a no-confidence vote.
title: French Government Under Pressure as Pension Talks Stumble

author: Yian Lee
description: China harshly condemned Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te for a speech aimed at rallying the democracy’s 23 million people to stand up to its larger neighbor — a back-and-forth that illustrates a deepening cross-strait divide.
title: China Slams Taiwan’s Lai for Speech Mentioning Independence

author: Arsalan Shahla, Fiona MacDonald, Catherine Lucey, Kate Sullivan
description: Iran and Israel may be nearing a pause in their 12-day war after President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire in a conflict that saw key Iranian military leaders and scientists eliminated, US bombing of Iranian nuclear sites and missiles launched at Israel and a US base in Qatar.
title: Iran-Israel War May Pause After Trump Says Ceasefire Reached

author: Brian Fowler
description: Japan and the US are still working on setting the timing for the next round of cabinet-level trade talks, Japan’s point person for the negotiations said, as the deadline for a deal to avert another hike in tariffs nears.
title: Japan’s Akazawa Says Still Working on Date for Next Trade Talks

author: Winnie Hsu
description: Asia’s stock benchmark climbed the most in seven weeks, led by technology shares, as risk sentiment improved after US President Donald Trump announced a tentative ceasefire between Israel and Iran.
title: Kospi Surges to Lead Stock Gains in Asia After Mideast Ceasefire

author: Angus Whitley
description: Australia’s online regulator called on the government to reverse its controversial exemption for YouTube from a social media ban for under-16s, an unusual intervention that echoes similar pleas from rival platforms including Facebook and TikTok.
title: YouTube Exemption From Australian Teen Social Media Ban Opposed by Regulator

author: Swati Pandey
title: Australia Must Choose Defense or Social Spending, Rabobank Says

author: Alex Morales, Fran Wang
description: The UK has urged Iran to de-escalate and return to talks with the international community following the announcement of a ceasefire in its conflict with Israel.
title: UK Urges Iran to Grasp Opportunity to Return to Talks

author: Anuchit Nguyen, Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s anti-graft agency will probe Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s controversial phone call with ex-Cambodian leader Hun Sen, according to local media reports, as her rivals seek legal recourse to force her ouster.
title: Thai PM Faces Legal Challenges After Averting Coalition Collapse

author: David Voreacos
description: A federal judge issued another court order letting Harvard University keep hosting foreign students, this one in its fight to overturn President Donald Trump’s proclamation barring their entry to the US.
title: Harvard Wins Longer Block on Trump’s Foreign Student Ban

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s consumer confidence rose to the highest in four years as easing domestic political uncertainty, fresh fiscal stimulus and hopes for pro-growth policies under the new administration buoyed sentiment.
title: Korean Consumer Confidence Jumps to 4-Year High on Stimulus Hope

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Republican Senator Bill Cassidy is seeking to delay a scheduled meeting of vaccine advisers selected by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. out of concern they’re not sufficiently qualified.
title: Key Senator Calls to Delay Meeting of New RFK Jr. Vaccine Panel
